intro: Eriocoma valdesii, commonly known as the Valdes' ericoid, is a low-growing shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that provides insulation against the cold and strong winds of its habitat. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Eriocoma valdesii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
